name: follow_up_missing_documents
description: Remote administrative assistant is waiting for important documents from a client and needs to follow up politely and clearly.
counterpart_role: HR coordinator at a partner company
student_task: You are a remote administrative assistant. You need several documents from an HR coordinator so you can complete a report, but they have not sent the files yet. Write a follow-up email. Politely remind them what documents you need, explain briefly why they are important, and ask if they can send them by a specific time or tell you when to expect them. Use clear, simple English and a respectful tone.
counterpart_style: You are an HR coordinator who receives many emails every day. You appreciate short, organized messages that clearly list what is needed and by when.
grading_focus: Focus on whether the student is polite, lists the needed documents clearly, mentions a reasonable time frame, and keeps the email organized and concise.
starter_email_generation_hint: Write a short email from the HR coordinator saying they will send some onboarding documents but not listing them all clearly or giving a specific time.
